column2: A directed graph has edges with a specified direction.
A stack can be implemented using a dynamic array.
A binary search tree can have more than one valid inorder traversal.
A breadth-first search algorithm can be used to find the shortest path in a graph.
In C++, a queue can be implemented using an array or a linked list.
A linked list can be used to implement a stack.
A stack can be implemented using a dynamic array.
A graph with no cycles is called a connected graph.
A spanning tree of a graph contains all the edges of the original graph.
In C++, a queue can be implemented using an array or a linked list.
A spanning tree of a graph contains the minimum number of edges required to connect all vertices.
A binary heap is a complete binary tree with the heap property.
A binary heap can be used to efficiently implement Kruskal's algorithm for minimum spanning trees.
A queue can be implemented using a doubly linked list.
A graph with no cycles is called an acyclic graph.
A queue can be implemented using a doubly linked list.
A graph with no cycles is called a directed acyclic graph (DAG).
Binary search trees guarantee constant time insertion and deletion operations.
A binary heap is a complete binary tree with the heap property.
A balanced binary search tree guarantees O(1) time complexity for most operations.
In C++, a queue can only be implemented using a linked list.
Stacks follow the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle.
A binary heap can be represented using an array.
A binary search tree guarantees O(N) time complexity for insertion and deletion operations.
Binary search trees guarantee constant time insertion and deletion operations.
A hash table guarantees O(1) time complexity for search operations.
A trie is a type of binary search tree.
A graph with no cycles and is connected is called a tree.
A binary tree can have at most two children per node.
A stack can be used to implement a linked list.
